author: uink45
content: Hey <@881905303011086387>, I am not sure if there has been discussions in the past about using the beacon chain light client to drive the EL during initial syncing. Is there a specification or documentation that has shared regarding this?

author: uink45
content: Also, regarding the implementation of sync protocol in the Nimbus client, what changes were needed to be made to the API endpoints to allow the light client to connect to the EL client? Source: https://nimbus.guide/el-light-client.html

author: etan_status
content:
You can use `--sync-light-client` to automatically have nimbus-eth2 pass the light client head to the EL while main sync is behind.
`--trusted-block-root` can be used to give it a recent block root (for bootstrap endpoint).

author: uink45
content: Right thanks! Also, could any implementation of sync protocol work with the engine API? As in, does the sync protocol need to be integrated with the beacon node or can it be decoupled so that you only need to run the light client and EL client? (Assuming the light client protocol is getting data through the Libp2p protocol.)

author: etan_status
content: that's what `nimbus_light_client` is doing (instead of `nimbus_beacon_node`) —— that's the link you shared
